Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: glazed black on rim; in handle zone black-figure decoration consisting of undetermined motif, possibly a wing with trace of added red; ancient repair hole.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 89 no. 300 pl. 66)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 405, no. B608, pl. XXVII, pl. CC)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1368) (phase 3)
